data.title: POLICE GALLANTRY: The King's Police Medal, the King's Police and Fire Service Medal and the Queen's Police Medal for Gallantry 1909
meta_keywords: British Police and Fire Service Gallantry Medals
data.meta_description: xv, + 252pp. Facsimile document endpapers (different front and rear). One colour-plate, small b/white biographical photos accompanying some entries, plus severa
data.text: xv, + 252pp. Facsimile document endpapers (different front and rear). One colour-plate, small b/white biographical photos accompanying some entries, plus several additional b/white halftone plate facsimiles. Book clean and square. Spine firm, nominally bumped on heel. Plain blue boards undamaged. A brief inscription ('To John, Best Wishes') signed and dated by the author on verso of half-title page, some (in-production) striation on several leaves, else textblock unmarked. Colour-illustrated dustjacket mildly edge, and shelf worn, else very good. The author, Peter Farmery, was a career policeman in and around London from 1958 until his retirement in 1986, receiving many police commendations and awards along the way. In 1987 he and his wife emigrated to Australia, allowing him to undertake the research for this amazing volume on (British) Police Gallantry. Using biographical photos when available, and a record of the circumstances leading to the award of the medals, contents include: Prelims., Foreword. Dedication. Introduction. Acks. Chronological List of Names and the Story of How the Medal was Won: King's Police Medal - Edward VII Issue. King's Police Medal - George V Issue. King's Police Medal - George V and VI Issue 'For Gallantry' - Reverse. King's Police and Fire Service Medal - Posthumous Award. Queen's Police Medal - Posthumous Awards. Appendices x 4. Index. Book weight approx. 850g. *Customers outside Australia - This item will incur extra postage charges as it will weigh over 1KG. with packing. Please email for quote.
